The Mumbai Monorail is a monorail system in the city of Mumbai, Maharashtra, India. It was built as part of a major expansion of public transport in the city and is implemented by the Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA). The system started commercial operation after partially opening its Phase 1 to the public in 2014 and is the first operational monorail network in India since the Patiala State Monorail Trainways closed in 1927. The Mumbai Monorail is the first operational monorail system used for rapid transit in independent India and is the first monorail in India since the Kundala Valley Railway and Patiala State Monorail Trainways were closed in the 1920s. It is considered a feeder system for the Metro trains in India.
